post_text: September 11th will forever be a day that changed America. Those of us that lived through it will always remember exactly where we were and what we were doing when the towers were hit. We promised then that we would never forget. This is the first year that none of our students were alive when this tragedy occurred. We take responsibility for making sure that the lessons we learned on September 11, 2001 are passed on to those that follow. The unity that followed is what we should model every day. The pride that we all had in being Americans and wanting to defend our country was powerful. During the tough times that have occurred in our country this year, we must always remember that we should be proud to live in this country. We will never forget.

Winter Weather Procedures

Petersburg ISD Procedure for Determining School Closure, Late Start or Early Release Due to Winter Weather Conditions.

As a District the safety of our students and staff is our number one priority. Petersburg ISD will use the following procedure to determine school closings, late starts and early releases due to weather.

District personnel will drive bus routes and major highways before 5:30 a.m.
District personnel will consult with the National Weather Service, TxDot and State and Local Law Enforcement for the latest road information and weather forecast.
If it is a determined that a late start or school closure is warranted our goal is to inform parents and staff by 6:00 a.m.

If the weather forces an early release parents will be notified as soon as possible.

Petersburg ISD will post late start or school closure information by 6:00 a.m. on the district website, district email to staff, Twitter, Facebook, and Lubbock news media. You can also go to our Petersburg ISD TX Mobile App and receive notifications that will also include weather-related information.
